humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor diameter, which is 4 cm. According to the rules, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor diameter is specified as 4 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 designation is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
